message.content:
1. Present Simple Tense: Used to describe actions that take place regularly or habitually in the present, or that always happen. Example: I eat breakfast every morning.
2. Present Progressive Tense: Used to describe ongoing actions that are happening right now at the moment of speaking. Example: She is eating her lunch right now.
3. Past Simple Tense: Used to describe completed actions in the past. Example: Yesterday, I went for a walk.
4. Past Progressive Tense: Used to describe an action that was ongoing in the past and has now stopped. Example: They were watching TV when the power went out.
5. Present Perfect Tense: Used to describe an action that started in the past but continues until the present. Example: I have lived in this city for five years.
6. Past Perfect Tense: Used to describe an action that was completed before another action in the past. Example: She had already finished her homework when the movie started.
7. Future Simple Tense: Used to describe future actions or events that will happen at a specific time in the future. Example: We will go to the beach on Sunday.
8. Present Continuous Tense: Used to describe ongoing actions that are happening right now and will continue into the future. Example: They are studying for their exams all day today.
